description: Number of ways to partition n labeled elements into sets of different sizes of at least 2 and order the sets.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..673
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember;      `if`(n=0, p!, `if`(i<2, 0, b(n, i-1, p)+      `if`(i>n, 0, b(n-i, i-1, p+1)*binomial(n, i))))    end:a:= n-> b(n$2, 0):seq(a(n), n=0..30);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 11 2016
author: _Christian G. Bower_
extensions: a(0)=1 prepended by _Alois P. Heinz_, May 11 2016
